channel.title: Basic concepts on JIPipe for ImageJ
channel.description: Recent content in Basic concepts on JIPipe for ImageJ

item.title: Batch processing
item.description: JIPipe was designed to always process data in batches, meaning that algorithms always work on multiple data sets at once. This greatly reduces the required work to upscale a processing pipeline from one or few to a large amount of data sets. We will use this pipeline as example: mermaid.initialize({startOnLoad:true}); graph LR; A[File] -- B[Load image] B -- C[Apply gaussian] In the pipeline, a file is provided as input. Then the file is loaded as image.
